detaileddescription.para: Typedef to the function used to compute the new step size. This should be a pointer to a function or a boost function.

memberdef.definition: typedef ReinitializableNumericalIntegratorBase::NumericalIntegratorBase:: StateDerivativeFunction tudat::numerical_integrators::RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::StateDerivativeFunction
memberdef.name: StateDerivativeFunction

briefdescription.para: Typedef to the state derivative function.

detaileddescription.para:
Typedef to the state derivative function inherited from the base class.
NumericalIntegrator::StateDerivativeFunction.
Last used step size, passed to either integrateTo( ) or performIntegrationStep( ).
Current independent variable as computed by performIntegrationStep().
Current state as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).
Last independent variable value as computed by performIntegrationStep().
Last state as computed by performIntegrationStep( ).
Coefficients for the integrator, as defined by the Butcher tableau.
Minimum step size.
Maximum step size.
Relative error tolerance per element in the state.
Absolute error tolerance per element in the state.

briefdescription.para: Safety factor for next step size.

detaileddescription.para: Safety factor used to scale prediction of next step size. This is usually picked between 0.8 and 0.9 (Burden and Faires, 2001).

briefdescription.para: Maximum factor increase for next step size.

detaileddescription.para: The maximum factor by which the next step size can increase compared to the current value. The need for this maximum stems from a need to ensure that the step size changes do not alias with the dynamics of the model being integrated. This is typically set at 4.0, based on numerical experiments (Burden and Faires, 2001).

briefdescription.para: Minimum factor decrease for next step size.

detaileddescription.para: The minimum factor by which the next step size can decrease compared to the current value. The need for this minimum stems from a need to ensure that the step size changes do not alias with the dynamics of the model being integrated. This is typically set at 0.1, based on numerical experiments (Burden and Faires, 2001).

briefdescription.para: Function that returns the new step size computed.

detaileddescription.para: Function that returns the new step size computed, as passed to the constructor.

memberdef.definition: std::vector< StateDerivativeType > tudat::numerical_integrators::RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::currentStateDerivatives_
memberdef.name: currentStateDerivatives_

detaileddescription.para: Vector of state derivatives, i.e. values of k_{i} in Runge-Kutta scheme.

briefdescription.para: Boolean denoting whether step size control is to be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (const RungeKuttaCoefficients &coefficients, const StateDerivativeFunction &stateDerivativeFunction, const IndependentVariableType intervalStart, const StateType &initialState, const IndependentVariableType minimumStepSize, const IndependentVariableType maximumStepSize, const StateType &relativeErrorTolerance, const StateType &absoluteErrorTolerance, const TimeStepType safetyFactorForNextStepSize=0.8, const TimeStepType maximumFactorIncreaseForNextStepSize=4.0, const TimeStepType minimumFactorDecreaseForNextStepSize=0.1, const NewStepSizeFunction &newStepSizeFunction=0)
memberdef.name: RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator

detaileddescription.para:
Default constructor, taking coefficients, a state derivative function, initial conditions, minimum & maximum step size and relative & absolute error tolerance per item in the state vector as argument.
coefficients
Coefficients to use with this integrator.
stateDerivativeFunction
State derivative function.
intervalStart
The start of the integration interval.
initialState
The initial state.
minimumStepSize
The minimum step size to take. If this constraint is violated, an exception will be thrown and the next state is computed using the minimum value.
maximumStepSize
The maximum step size to take. If this constraint is violated, an exception will be thrown and the next state is computed using the maximum value.
relativeErrorTolerance
The relative error tolerance, for each individual state vector element.
absoluteErrorTolerance
The absolute error tolerance, for each individual state vector element.
safetyFactorForNextStepSize
Safety factor used to scale prediction of next step size.
maximumFactorIncreaseForNextStepSize
Maximum factor increase for next step size.
minimumFactorDecreaseForNextStepSize
Maximum factor decrease for next step size.
newStepSizeFunction
Function that returns the new step size computed, default: RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator::computeNewStepSize.
NumericalIntegrator::NumericalIntegrator.

memberdef.argsstring: (const RungeKuttaCoefficients &coefficients, const StateDerivativeFunction &stateDerivativeFunction, const IndependentVariableType intervalStart, const StateType &initialState, const TimeStepType minimumStepSize, const TimeStepType maximumStepSize, const typename StateType::Scalar relativeErrorTolerance, const typename StateType::Scalar absoluteErrorTolerance, const TimeStepType safetyFactorForNextStepSize=0.8, const TimeStepType maximumFactorIncreaseForNextStepSize=4.0, const TimeStepType minimumFactorDecreaseForNextStepSize=0.1, const NewStepSizeFunction &newStepSizeFunction=0)
memberdef.name: RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator

detaileddescription.para:
Default constructor, taking coefficients a state derivative function, initial conditions, minimum & maximum step size and relative & absolute error tolerance for all items in the state vector as argument.
coefficients
Coefficients to use with this integrator.
stateDerivativeFunction
State derivative function.
intervalStart
The start of the integration interval.
initialState
The initial state.
minimumStepSize
The minimum step size to take. If this constraint is violated, an exception will be thrown and the next state is computed using the minimum value.
maximumStepSize
The maximum step size to take. If this constraint is violated, an exception will be thrown and the next state is computed using the maximum value.
relativeErrorTolerance
The relative error tolerance, equal for all individual state vector elements.
absoluteErrorTolerance
The absolute error tolerance, equal for all individual state vector elements.
safetyFactorForNextStepSize
Safety factor used to scale prediction of next step size.
maximumFactorIncreaseForNextStepSize
Maximum factor increase for next step size.
minimumFactorDecreaseForNextStepSize
Maximum factor decrease for next step size.
newStepSizeFunction
Function that returns the new step size computed, default: RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator::computeNewStepSize.
NumericalIntegrator::NumericalIntegrator.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current state derivatives, i.e., the values of k_{i} (stage evaluations) in Runge-Kutta scheme.
Current state derivatives evaluated according to stages of Runge-Kutta scheme.

Perform a single integration step and compute a new step size.
stepSize
The step size to take. If the time step is too large to satisfy the error constraints, the step is redone until the error constraint is satisfied.
The state at the end of the interval.

memberdef.definition: virtual bool tudat::numerical_integrators::RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::rollbackToPreviousState
memberdef.name: rollbackToPreviousState

briefdescription.para: Rollback internal state to the last state.

detaileddescription.para:
Performs rollback of the internal state to the last state. This function can only be called once after calling integrateTo( ) or performIntegrationStep( ) unless specified otherwise by implementations, and can not be called before any of these functions have been called. Will return true if the rollback was successful, and false otherwise.
True if the rollback was successful.

Returns the previoius value of the independent variable of the integrator.
Previous independent variable.

Returns the previous value of the state.
Previous state

briefdescription.para: Replace the state with a new value.

detaileddescription.para:
Replace the state with a new value. This allows for discrete jumps in the state, often used in simulations of discrete events. In astro, this relates to simulations of rocket staging, impulsive shots, parachuting, ideal control, etc. The modified state, by default, cannot be rolled back; to do this, either set the flag to true, or store the state before calling this function the first time, and call it again with the initial state as parameter to revert to the state before the discrete change.
newState
The value of the new state.
allowRollback
Boolean denoting whether roll-back should be allowed.

memberdef.argsstring: (const StateType &newState, const IndependentVariableType newTime, const bool allowRollback=false)
memberdef.name: modifyCurrentIntegrationVariables

briefdescription.para: Modify the state and time for the current step.

detaileddescription.para:
Modify the state and time for the current step.
newState
The new state to set the current state to.
newTime
The time to set the current time to.
allowRollback
Boolean denoting whether roll-back should be allowed.

Function to toggle the use of step-size control
useStepSizeControl
Boolean denoting whether step size control is to be used

memberdef.argsstring: (const StateType &lowerOrderEstimate, const StateType &higherOrderEstimate, const TimeStepType stepSize)
memberdef.name: computeNextStepSizeAndValidateResult

briefdescription.para: Computes the next step size and validates the result.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the next step size and validate the result.

Computes the next step size based on a higher and lower order estimate, determines if the error is within bounds and returns a new step size.
lowerOrderEstimate
The integrated result with the lower order coefficients.
higherOrderEstimate
The integrated result with the higher order coefficients.
stepSize
The step size used to obtain these results.
True if the error was within bounds, false otherwise.

memberdef.definition: std::pair< TimeStepType, bool > tudat::numerical_integrators::RungeKuttaVariableStepSizeIntegrator< IndependentVariableType, StateType, StateDerivativeType, TimeStepType >::computeNewStepSize
memberdef.argsstring: (const TimeStepType stepSize, const std::pair< TimeStepType, TimeStepType > &orders, const TimeStepType safetyFactorForNextStepSize, const std::pair< TimeStepType, TimeStepType > &minimumAndMaximumFactorsForNextStepSize, const StateType &relativeErrorTolerance, const StateType &absoluteErrorTolerance, const StateType &lowerOrderEstimate, const StateType &higherOrderEstimate)
memberdef.name: computeNewStepSize

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the new step size based on a generic definition of the local truncation error.
stepSize
Integration step size of current step.
orders
Pair of lower and higher orders of the two schemes used in variable step size integration. Note that the order is important (lower first, higher second).
safetyFactorForNextStepSize
Safety factor used to scale prediction of next step size.
minimumAndMaximumFactorsForNextStepSize
Pair of minimum and maximum safety factor decrease and increase for computing the next step size. Note that the order is important (minimum first, maximum second).
relativeErrorTolerance
Allowable relative error between integrations using two schemes.
absoluteErrorTolerance
Allowable relative error between integrations using two schemes.
lowerOrderEstimate
Numerical integration result using lower order scheme.
higherOrderEstimate
Numerical integration result using higher order scheme.
Pair with new step size and a boolean denoting whether the step size computation was succesfull, i.e. whether tolerances etc. are met.
Computes the new step size based on a generic definition of the local truncation error.

briefdescription.para: Class that implements the Runge-Kutta variable stepsize integrator.

detaileddescription.para:
Class that implements the Runge-Kutta variable step size integrator.
StateType
The type of the state. This type should be an Eigen::Matrix derived type.
StateDerivativeType
The type of the state derivative. This type should be an Eigen::Matrix derived type.
IndependentVariableType
The type of the independent variable. This type should be either a float or double.
NumericalIntegrator.
